SOLR Options (groups and values);Review Auto Approve;Date and currency options.
Control the reasons that are offered in the Contact Us form
Manage Email Templates that are used in all outgoing emails.
Manage the “From”, “To” and other attributes of outgoing emails.
Manage eCommerce displayed labels and captions.
Review Auto Approve; Date and currency options
For some changes to take effect, the “cache” may need to be reset or the SOLR index regenerated.
View system configuration files and other properties.
Parameters and configuration options for the various supported Payment Gateways. This will include all parameters, API references, access information etc.
Function to maintain 3rd party pixel tracking scripts on various pages throughout the eCommerce implementation.
This function provides the ability to associated various OFBiz payment functions to specific Payment Gateways.

This function will clear various memory cache that are used within the BigFish solution. These resources are loaded into memory once and if changes are made in these areas then cache needs to be cleared for the changes to take affect.

GENERAL CACHE: This function will clear the cache for the Labels-and-Captions, DIV-sequencing and SEO-Friendly-URLs. These resources are loaded into memory once and if changes are made in these areas then cache needs to be cleared for the changes to take affect.

PIXEL TRACKING CACHE: This function will clear the specific cache used for the Pixel Tracking Code that may be setup for the implementation. These resources are loaded into memory once and if changes are made in these areas then cache needs to be cleared for the changes to take affect.
This function will allow for the quick entry of a Product within the Product Catalog structure.
This function will allow for revisions of pricing for any product within the catalog.
This function provides the ability to search, review, edit and remove products from within the catalog.
This function provides the ability to view and maintain the product catalog structure.
Used as the image displayed within a Category Listing Page
Manage all generic and re-usable content to be included within other content areas.
Used as the popup image when the customer clicks on “View Larger Image” or similar
New content is only valid if you use a specific BF-Content-ID that is used in the eCommerce implementation. This function should only be used for emergency situations.
Manage additional text that is maintained for a sub-category and displayed on each PDP page within that sub-category.
Manage content that appears on each PLP page or as a Mega-Menu. These are associated with Product CATEGORIES.
This function will use your OFBiz and BigFish properties and send out a test email.
Various functions to export data, mainly focused on content, from the database to an XML format. These XML files will be suitable for load into another OFBiz database instance.
To manage special text that appears on the PDP for Introduction and Discontinued products.
Manage all the site images that can be referenced in various content throughout the site
Used as the initial primary image display in the PDP
Used as the alternate primary image display in the PDP

The Facet GROUP are, for example, COLOR, MATERIAL etc. Facet GROUPS are managed for each level of the Product Category structure. The function provides the ability to hide or show specific facet GROUPS and sequence the GROUPS within the faceted navigation panel.

The Facet VALUES are the values within a group, for example, VALUES of Red, Green, Blue within the GROUP Color. This function provides the ability to manage the sequencing of the Facet VALUES on a global basis by broadcasting to every Product. For specific Product level sequencing of Facet VALUES, use the Catalog / Product / Facet Sequencing function.
Control the reasons that are offered in the Contact Us form
Ability to maintain which credit cards are offered during the Check Out process. Example: Visa, Mastercard etc.
Ability to maintain which Ages are offered during the Write a Review process. Example: 10-21, 22-30 etc.
Ability to maintain which Titles are offered during the Registration process. Example: Mr, Mrs etc.
Manage specific eSpots for Login, Cart and other pages.
Manage the Home Page content spots.
Manage additional text that is maintained for a sub-category and displayed on each PDP page within that sub-category.
Manage spots that appear on each PLP page.
This function will maintain the sequencing of <DIV> tags, by screen. All data is held in the file “OSafeUiSequence.xml”.
Manage all the site images and other media that can be referenced in various content throughout the site
Note: preview image resized from original H=${height}px, W=${originalWidth}px to H=${height}px, W=${width}px
Maintain the captions in the PDP for the variant selectors (color, size etc.)
Enter Criteria and click the Search button
This function will allow for browsing and downloading of any Contact Us events that are stored.
This function will allow for the quick addition of a Customer.
This function provides the ability to search for customers in the database. A list of customers is displayed, with a click-through to the Customer Detail screen
* Only specify if the images are defined as file-names only in the XLS input; this will define the directory where they are located
This function will allow for the quick addition of a Sales Order.
This function provides the ability to search for orders in the database. A list of orders is displayed, with a click-through to the Order Detail screen
Manage all BigFish feed processing. Import Products, Order Status. Export Customers, Orders and more.
Manage specific content spots for Login, Cart and other pages
Import Product Catalog and Item data. Setup selectable and descriptive features.
This function will read an XLS or XML import file that defines Product Information. There are options to re-load (remove existing and load fresh) or append to the Product entities.
This function allows for the configuration of all promotions.
This function allows for the management of all promotions.
This function provides the ability to view promotions and gauge the usage for a certain time period.
This function allows for the creation of a new Promotion.
This function will allow for browsing and downloading of any Request Catalog events that are stored.
Search, review and edit any consumer reviews.

This function will generate a sitemap.xml and display the results within this browser. You may then save and deploy the file as appropriate. Sitemap URL’s will include all active Product Catalog data and Static Pages.
This function will refresh the SEO Friendly URL Mapping File (XML).
This function will re-index SOLR. It should be executed whenever the Product Catalog is updated so that PLP, PDP and Faceted Navigation is refreshed.
Quick link to add a Store.
* Must be blank to define a new Top Category Item
Used in PLP “alternate” image view (typically on hover)
This tool will compare the Label / Captions file installed on this server (the “A” version) with another instance (the “B” version). Access to the “B” version is required.
This tool will compare the DIV-Sequence file installed on this server (the “A” version) with another instance (the “B” version). Access to the “B” version is required.
This tool will compare the SYSTEM_PARAMETERS database entity on this server (the “A” version) with another instance (the “B” version). Access to the “B” database is required.
ECOMMERCE Implementation: Load new CSS files onto the server; change which CSS file is "active".
ADMIN MODULE Implementation: Load new CSS files onto the server; change which CSS file is "active".
ECOMMERCE Implementation: Simple edit and Save-As capability so that the primary CSS file can be modified.
ADMIN MODULE Implementation: Simple edit and Save-As capability so that the primary CSS file can be modified.

The Email was sent successfully. HOWEVER, the mail.notifications.redirectTo is set to {0} so all emails will be sent here. Check the client-deployment.properties file. Specific email properties are listed in the 'General Properties' section. For more information check the Help function "How To Set Up BigFish Emails".

The Email was sent successfully. If for some reason it was not delivered, check the client-deployment.properties file. Specific email properties are listed in the ‘General Properties’ section. It is possible that these are not configured correctly. For more information check the Help function "How To Set Up BigFish Emails".

The Email was sent successfully. HOWEVER, the mail.notifications.enabled is set to ''N' in the client.properties file so the email content was stored as a COMMUNICATION_EVENT in the database and no real email was delivered.

Required by the Payment Gateway in order to match the customer Credit Card Number to the correct Credit Card Type.
Set to 0 (zero) if not required or hidden

Limit Per Order: The total number of times a specific Promo can be applied to an Order. Remember that some promos are applied at the cart Product level. If a Promo is allowed to be applied to multiple Product line items then this should be set accordingly. Otherwise, and in most cases, this should be set to 1.

Limit Per Customer: The total number of times a specific Promo can be applied for a Customer. Remember that some promos are applied at the cart Product level. If a Promo is allowed to be applied to multiple Product line items then this should be set accordingly.
Limit Per Promotion: the total number of times a Promotion can be used. This will be the sum of the child Promo-Codes usage.
Limit Per Code: The total number of times a specific Promo can be applied. Also consider the Limit-Per-Promotion setting on the Promotion.

Limit Per Customer: The total number of times a specific Promo can be applied for a Customer. Remember that some promos are applied at the cart Product level. If a Promo is allowed to be applied to multiple Product line items then this should be set accordingly.
This should identify the XML file that will be used to identify the actual output file.
To import the XML file into another BigFish instance: use standard OFBiz, click on Webtools, and use the Import XML function. More information is available in the Online Help.
